headline.main: What We Can Learn From Third-World Health Care

docs.abstract: Applying the successes of medical organizations that have delivered high-quality care under some of the most challenging circumstances possible could offer hope for improving our country's health care woes.
docs.snippet: Applying the successes of medical organizations that have delivered high-quality care under some of the most challenging circumstances possible could offer hope for improving our country's health care woes.

headline.main: Funerals, Fried Chicken and Social Media

docs.abstract: The Internet talk show, which is on the air twice a month on Sunday evenings, aims to persuade listeners not to dig their own graves with knives and forks.
docs.snippet: The Internet talk show, which is on the air twice a month on Sunday evenings, aims to persuade listeners not to dig their own graves with knives and forks.

headline.seo: At Hearing on Soda Ban, Strong Words Both Sides
headline.print_headline: Strong Words From Both Sides at a Hearing on Bloomberg’s Soda Ban
headline.main: Strong Words From Both Sides at Soda Ban Hearing

docs.abstract: New York City Board of Health holds public hearing on proposed ban on large size servings of soft drinks from the Bloomberg administration; speakers are split, with one group praising the fight against obesity and opponents arguing that ban would strip choices from consumers; Board of Health, appointed entirely by Mayor Bloomberg, is scheduled to vote on the proposal in September.
docs.lead_paragraph: Speakers before the New York City Board of Health split along two lines, with one group saying the mayor’s proposal would fight obesity and another saying it would strip choices from consumers.
docs.snippet: Speakers before the New York City Board of Health split along two lines, with one group saying the mayor’s proposal would fight obesity and another saying it would strip choices from consumers.

headline.main: Live Blog: Public Hearing on Proposed Soda Ban

docs.abstract: The city’s Board of Health, which will vote on Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg’s proposal to restrict the size of sugary drinks in September, is holding its lone public hearing.
docs.snippet: The city’s Board of Health, which will vote on Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg’s proposal to restrict the size of sugary drinks in September, is holding its lone public hearing.

headline.main: Personal Health: The Ideal and the Real of Breast-Feeding

docs.abstract: Jane E Brody Personal Health column notes mounting concern that campaigns to encourage mothers to breastfeed may be creating undeserved guilt and hardships for a growing number of new mothers; holds that many mothers cannot afford, professionally or financially, the prolonged maternity leaves needed to breast-feed their infants for the time now recommended. Drawing (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: Concern is mounting that the ''breast is best'' dogma is creating undeserved guilt and serious hardships for a growing number of new mothers, many of whom work full time and cannot afford, professionally or financially, the prolonged maternity leaves needed to breast-feed their infants for the time now recommended. Forty-three years ago, when my twin sons were born, the pressure to breast-feed exclusively for six months was not as strong as it is today. I nonetheless felt I had let them - and myself - down when this proved impossible. I had looked forward to feeding only breast milk for the six months of maternity leave my job allowed. But nature had a different plan.
docs.snippet: Concern is mounting that the ''breast is best'' dogma is creating undeserved guilt and serious hardships for a growing number of new mothers, many of whom work full time and cannot afford, professionally or financially, the prolonged maternity leaves...

headline.main: Fighting Ban On Big Sodas With Appeals To Patriotism

docs.abstract: American soft-drink industry holds a rally at New York's City Hall to protest the Bloomberg administration's proposed restrictions on the sales of large-sized sugary drinks; appeals to populism and patriotism are rampant, while the topic of obesity receives only an occasional mention. (M)h
docs.lead_paragraph: Claims of tyranny. Calls for more freedom. And a banner with a Statue of Liberty-like figure triumphantly holding aloft a large soda cup, complete with straw. The American soft-drink industry arrived at City Hall on Monday to protest theBloomberg administration's proposed restrictions on sales of big sugary drinks. While appeals to populism and patriotism were rampant, the topic of obesity received only an occasional mention.
